intro: Antiaris toxicaria subsp. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to several meters in height. Its bark and leaves contain toxic compounds, which have been used historically in traditional medicine and as a poison. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
